I just completed the tevfifty with my mega archmage.  I am saving him 
because I spent hours bringing him up to his mega levels.  I will be 
sending my slightly legitimate team through soon.  Now for the review:

Plotwise, it makes sense.

The forest was a bit tight fit for getting through with an archmage.

Having my teleporter marker blocked in the stairs and the labryinth 
was a little annoying.

I had to go back through twice on some levels because I missed an
exit 
door (I got stuck and couldn't get to higher scenario numbers.  Of 
course, I missed exits on the normal levels too).

How did you get that little trick where your NPCs die and 
automatically lose?

Quality-wise:  you must have spent weeks designing the Labryinth and 
the stairs.  Other scenarios show that you spent time designing them.

Hmm.  I liked your 'isolation' level a lot and it gave me ideas on 
what not to do and what to do when designing such a level.

Overall, it was really enjoyable and playable.  Excellent work.
